page.title: 16Bishton.
page.content: There is a hamlet known as Bishton to the north of the river and the canal. There is a garage on the main A51 with a post office nearby. There are three farms and a few houses. Some are of the post war type and the others are cottages that belonged in the past to Bishton Hall. Since the Second World War Bishton Hall has been a Roman Catholic preparatory school known as St. Bede's School. It was formerly the home of the Sneyds and the Sparrows who were great benefactors to this area of Staffordshire. This part of the county has remained unchanged for some thirty years and is a typical rural Midlands scene. The farmland is mostly arable with some acreage given over to sheep rearing. The London Midland railway crosses through this area.
